intro: Chorizanthe thurberi var. cryptantha, commonly known as Thurber's choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its native range.
